title: How to know who typed what in Google Docs - Quora

response.answer_text: Google Docs really suffers from this tremendously! Lacking a MUST FEATURE in collaborative writing is almost insane in 2019 … It’ logical for collaborative writing to know WHO wrote WHAT. It’s even crazier that Google Doc already has it in the Version history, but it's not a solution when we want to see the integrative final version and see whose part is what - to go through all the versions to try to get it?!? :D So, “Google”, please, just enable it for the integral, final version to turn on some coloring that shows WHO wrote WHAT.

Hi there! Inside a Google Doc, go to File > See Revision History. It will show you a complete record of who wrote what, when the changes were made, and you can also “roll back” the document to an earlier version, if needed. This is a good overview I found that shows how it works (run time 2:01).  I hope that helps. Cheers! -Naomi
